team.cascade.spout.makememod.helper.config
Class CommentConfiguration

Object
  CommentConfiguration
Direct Known Subclasses:
Configuration
public abstract class CommentConfiguration
extends Object

Handel's all the saving, loading, checking for new version, reloading and transferring the config to and from the enums.
You shouldn't really change anything in here normally all the things you perhaps want to change is in Configuration.

Version:
$FullVersion$
Author:
$Author: dredhorse$

Constructor Detail

CommentConfiguration

public CommentConfiguration(Plugin plugin)
Constructor for CommentConfiguration, you will still need perhaps to configure some stuff.

Parameters:
plugin - the main plugin class as reference
See Also:
for more information
Method Detail

defaultInit

abstract void defaultInit()
Method which will use the DEBUG_LOG_ENABLED, DEBUG_LOG_TO_FILE, CHECK_FOR_UPDATE, CONFIG_AUTO_UPDATE, CONFIG_AUTO_SAVE, CONFIG_LOG_ENABLED enums to overwrite the default values configured in here.

If you don't want to use those enums make sure that you delete the corresponding references here!

saveConfig

public boolean saveConfig()
Method to save the configuration to file, this is done automatically if configured after every change.
This method will only save if the configuration was changed, if the config file doesn't exist it will try to create it.

Returns:
true if the save was successful or no change required

reloadConfig

public boolean reloadConfig()
Method to handle the reloading of the configuration, this is done if configured automatically when the config was AutoUpdated, changed or manually. Note: This method will save the config if there was a change before, otherwise it will just load the config again. Note: This method doesn't need to be called explicitly, but you can if you want

Returns:
true if the reload was successful, false if there was an issue.

loadConfig

public boolean loadConfig()
Loads the configuration into memory via loadConfigToMemory(String) and will than change the default config options

Returns:
true if loading was successful
Throws:
ConfigNotAvailableException - if there was a problem during loading to memory.

set

public boolean set(CONFIG configNode,
                   Object value)
The best way to set the configuration options, as this will flag the config dirty and will also trigger a save of the config

if CONFIG.CONFIG_AUTO_SAVE is enabled

Parameters:
configNode - configuration node to set
value - object value to set
Returns:
false if there was a WrongClassException

isConfigAutoSave

public boolean isConfigAutoSave()
Convenience method to get the state of CONFIG.CONFIG_AUTO_SAVE

Returns:
state of CONFIG.CONFIG_AUTO_SAVE

alterConfigCurrent

public void alterConfigCurrent(String conCurr)
Allows changing of the Configuration Version, which is being used to compare against the version inside the configuration file. This will also alter the configVer value which is used to create the configuration file

Parameters:
conCurr - new String value of the new version

alterPluginSlug

public void alterPluginSlug(String plugSlug)
Allows changing of the URL which is included in the configuration file

Parameters:
plugSlug - new String value of the URL

initializeConfig

public void initializeConfig()
                      throws ConfigNotAvailableException
Initialize the Config, this should done be AFTER setting the needed values, which can be either values needed for the ENUMs (see the example code) or values needed for the class itself:

Throws:
ConfigNotAvailableException - when the config can not correctly be initialized
See Also:
alterConfigCurrent(String),

we do the following:

  • create the config if it doesn't exist {@link #writeConfigToFile()}
  • load the config to memory {@link #loadConfigToMemory(String)}
  • fix the most common yaml issues if necessary {@link #fixYamlIssues()}
  • check if we could read something at all
  • apply the config to the enums {@link #configurationReading()}
  • set debug and config level correctly
  • check if there is an update available if configured {@link #autoCheck()}
  • check if the configuration requires an update and saves it if configured {@link #reloadConfig()}

versionCheck

public boolean versionCheck()
Method to figure out if we are out of date or running on an older / newer build of Spout. Will also set the getNewVersion field.

Returns:
true if version is same as the version on the web, false if there is a difference or web not accessible

getInstance

public static CommentConfiguration getInstance()
                                        throws ConfigNotInitializedException
Returns the instance of the configuration class

Returns:
configuration Class
Throws:
ConfigNotInitializedException - when configuration wasn't initialized

getNewVersion

public static String getNewVersion()
Returns the new Version which is available if known otherwise null

Returns:
new available version or null

isNewVersionAvailable

public static boolean isNewVersionAvailable()
Checks if there is a new plugin available

Returns:
true if new plugin is available

alterVersionUrl

public void alterVersionUrl(String versionURL)
Allows setting of the url which contains the actual version number

Parameters:
versionURL -
